text:
Linda Thomas-Greenfield (born 1952) is an American politician. She was the Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs in the United States Department of State's Bureau of African Affairs from 2013 to 2017.
In November 2020, President-elect Joe Biden announced his plans to nominate Thomas-Greenfield as the next United States Ambassador to the United Nations.
